001package io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.base;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.log.LogQuest;
004import java.util.HashMap;
005import java.util.List;
006import java.util.Map;
007import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired;
008import org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext;
009import org.springframework.context.annotation.Lazy;
010import org.springframework.stereotype.Component;
011
012import static io.cyborgcode.utilities.reflections.ReflectionUtil.getFieldValues;
013
014/**
015 * Manages and provides access to fluent service instances.
016 *
017 * <p>This class is responsible for retrieving and caching service instances,
018 * ensuring efficient access to dynamically managed components.
019 *
020 * <p>Services are lazily initialized and stored in an internal cache to optimize performance.
021 *
022 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
023 */
024@Component
025@Lazy
026public class Services {
027
028   /**
029    * The application context for retrieving service beans.
030    */
031   private final ApplicationContext applicationContext;
032
033   /**
034    * Cache for storing retrieved service instances.
035    */
036   private final Map<Class<?>, Object> serviceCache = new HashMap<>();
037
038   /**
039    * Constructs a new {@code Services} instance with the provided application context.
040    *
041    * @param applicationContext The application context used for retrieving service beans.
042    */
043   @Autowired
044   public Services(ApplicationContext applicationContext) {
045      this.applicationContext = applicationContext;
046   }
047
048   /**
049    * Retrieves a service instance for the specified fluent service class and service type.
050    *
051    * <p>If the requested service is not already cached, it is retrieved from the application context
052    * and stored for future access.
053    *
054    * @param fluentServiceClass The class representing the fluent service.
055    * @param serviceClass       The type of service to retrieve.
056    * @param <T>                The type of the fluent service.
057    * @param <K>                The type of the requested service.
058    * @return The requested service instance.
059    * @throws IllegalStateException if no matching service bean is found.
060    */
061   public <T extends ClassLevelHook, K> K service(Class<T> fluentServiceClass, Class<K> serviceClass) {
062
063      return serviceClass.cast(serviceCache.computeIfAbsent(serviceClass, key -> {
064         ClassLevelHook fluentService = applicationContext.getBeansOfType(ClassLevelHook.class)
065               .values().stream()
066               .filter(fluent -> fluent.getClass().equals(fluentServiceClass))
067               .findFirst()
068               .orElseThrow(() -> new IllegalStateException(
069                     "No bean found for the specified fluentServiceClass: " + fluentServiceClass.getName()));
070
071         List<K> fieldValues = getFieldValues(fluentService, serviceClass);
072         if (fieldValues.size() > 1) {
073            LogQuest.warn(
074                  "There is more than one service from type: {} inside class: {}. The first one will be taken: {}",
075                  serviceClass, fluentServiceClass, fieldValues.get(0));
076         }
077         return fieldValues.get(0);
078      }));
079   }
080
081}
